title: How Can I Identify Which Mode of Nature (Guna) Is InfluencingÂ Me? | Sri Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.key_quote: We are not this body, but we cannot be ignorant of this body.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of understanding the influence of the modes of nature on our body and mind, referring to the body as a 'yantra' that needs to be trained.

segments.key_quote: If your vision is that you are seeing chillis and tamarind and this and that, you should eat.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how to understand the modes of nature through our eating habits, emphasizing the importance of Krishna consciousness while eating prasadam and understanding how different foods affect our senses.

segments.key_quote: By carefully understanding our body, what suits and what not suits, we can keep our bodily thing little on a sattvic platform.
segments.summary: The speaker continues discussing the importance of understanding our body and its reactions to food, emphasizing the need for a sattvic diet to maintain health and facilitate devotional service.

segments.key_quote: Any time when you want to do some work, immediately mind says, No, not now. Later, later, later.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an anecdote about a young man with multiple health issues and then discusses how the modes of nature influence our work ethic, particularly procrastination (ignorance) and the desire for recognition (passion).

segments.key_quote: Regular reading, regular association with Vaishnavas. That is the only remedy.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the importance of regular reading and association with Vaishnavas as the remedy for overcoming the influence of the modes of nature and progressing in devotional service.
